server.event

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.event.Task

  • public abstract class Task
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a periodic task that can be scheduled with a TaskScheduler.
    Author:
    Graham

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Task()
      Creates a new task with a delay of 1 cycle.
      Task(boolean immediate)
      Creates a new task with a delay of 1 cycle and immediate flag.
      Task(int delay)
      Creates a new task with the specified delay.
      Task(int delay, boolean immediate)
      Creates a new task with the specified delay and immediate flag.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isImmediate()
      Checks if this task is an immediate task.
      boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the task is running.
      boolean isStopped()
      Checks if the task is stopped.
      void setDelay(int delay)
      Changes the delay of this task.
      void stop()
      Stops this task.
      boolean tick()
      This method should be called by the scheduling class every cycle.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task()
        Creates a new task with a delay of 1 cycle.

      • Task

        public Task(boolean immediate)
        Creates a new task with a delay of 1 cycle and immediate flag.
        Parameters:
        immediate - A flag that indicates if for the first execution there should be no delay.

      • Task

        public Task(int delay)
        Creates a new task with the specified delay.
        Parameters:
        delay - The number of cycles between consecutive executions of this task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is not positive.

      • Task

        public Task(int delay,
            boolean immediate)
        Creates a new task with the specified delay and immediate flag.
        Parameters:
        delay - The number of cycles between consecutive executions of this task.
        immediate - A flag which indicates if for the first execution there should be no delay.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is not positive.

    • Method Detail

      • isImmediate

        public boolean isImmediate()
        Checks if this task is an immediate task.
        Returns:
        true if so, false if not.

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Checks if the task is running.
        Returns:
        true if so, false if not.

      • isStopped

        public boolean isStopped()
        Checks if the task is stopped.
        Returns:
        true if so, false if not.

      • tick

        public boolean tick()
        This method should be called by the scheduling class every cycle. It updates the countdown and calls the execute() method if necessary.
        Returns:
        A flag indicating if the task is running.

      • setDelay

        public void setDelay(int delay)
        Changes the delay of this task.
        Parameters:
        delay - The number of cycles between consecutive executions of this task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is not positive.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops this task.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the task has already been stopped.
